author: globo.com
title: Garimpeiros atacam policiais federais que destruÃ­ram mais de 300 dragas ilegais no Amazonas | Jornal Nacional | G1
text:
PF destrÃ³i mais de 300 dragas do garimpo ilegal no Amazonas
A PolÃ­cia Federal destruiu mais de 300 dragas de garimpo ilegal no Amazonas.
O Rio Madeira, que corta o sul do Amazonas, se transformou em um corredor repleto de dragas. Os agentes da PolÃ­cia Federal colocam explosivos em todas que encontram pela frente. Segundo a PF, a maioria das dragas estÃ¡ concentrada na regiÃ£o de HumaitÃ¡. Os agentes contam com o apoio de drones e helicÃ³pteros para mapear os locais.
As mÃ¡quinas sugam a areia do fundo do rio, que depois Ã© misturada com mercÃºrio para a extraÃ§Ã£o do ouro. As Ã¡guas ficam contaminadas e os peixes morrem. A populaÃ§Ã£o indÃ­gena e ribeirinha que vive nas imediaÃ§Ãµes tambÃ©m Ã© afetada.
1 de 3 Garimpeiros atacam policiais federais que destruÃ­ram mais de 300 dragas ilegais no Amazonas â€” Foto: ReproduÃ§Ã£o/TV Globo Garimpeiros atacam policiais federais que destruÃ­ram mais de 300 dragas ilegais no Amazonas â€” Foto: ReproduÃ§Ã£o/TV Globo
De acordo com a PF, os garimpeiros aproveitam essa Ã©poca de estiagem, quando o nÃ­vel dos rios estÃ¡ mais baixo, para retirar o ouro do rio com mais facilidade. Ainda segundo as investigaÃ§Ãµes, o garimpo ilegal tambÃ©m ocorre em Ã¡reas indÃ­genas.
2 de 3 Garimpeiros atacam policiais federais que destruÃ­ram mais de 300 dragas ilegais no Amazonas â€” Foto: ReproduÃ§Ã£o/TV Globo Garimpeiros atacam policiais federais que destruÃ­ram mais de 300 dragas ilegais no Amazonas â€” Foto: ReproduÃ§Ã£o/TV Globo
Na quarta-feira (21), por causa da operaÃ§Ã£o, os garimpeiros fizeram protestos na cidade de HumaitÃ¡. Eles atacaram os agentes da PF com rojÃµes e pedras. Os policiais reagiram e seguiram com a fiscalizaÃ§Ã£o no Rio Madeira.
Depois, os garimpeiros tentaram invadir a prefeitura e houve novo confronto, desta vez com a PolÃ­cia Militar, que usou balas de borracha. Uma pessoa ficou ferida. Estudantes e funcionÃ¡rios de uma escola ficaram assustados.
"NÃ³s, funcionÃ¡rios aqui da escola, juntamente com a gestora e os professores, conseguimos tambÃ©m amenizar a situaÃ§Ã£o, deixando os alunos dentro da escola o mais pacÃ­fico possÃ­velâ€, conta Raimundo dos Santos, porteiro da escola.
3 de 3 Garimpeiros atacam policiais federais que destruÃ­ram mais de 300 dragas ilegais no Amazonas â€” Foto: ReproduÃ§Ã£o/TV Globo Garimpeiros atacam policiais federais que destruÃ­ram mais de 300 dragas ilegais no Amazonas â€” Foto: ReproduÃ§Ã£o/TV Globo
A polÃ­cia prendeu seis suspeitos por associaÃ§Ã£o criminosa, dano ao patrimÃ´nio e lesÃ£o corporal. A operaÃ§Ã£o da PF no Rio Madeira deve durar mais 10 dias.
"Esse tipo de comportamento justifica os dois eixos estratÃ©gicos da PolÃ­cia Federal no combate ao crime ambiental: tanto a parte dissuasÃ³ria, a parte tÃ¡tica, operacional, ostensiva, onde se destrÃ³i esses equipamentos, quanto a parte de polÃ­cia judiciÃ¡ria, que Ã© quando a PolÃ­cia Federal se debruÃ§a em investigaÃ§Ãµes estruturantes para poder combater tambÃ©m a lavagem de dinheiro e capitalizar as lideranÃ§as desses crimesâ€, afirma o delegado JoÃ£o Garrido, superintendente da PolÃ­cia Federal/AM.
LEIA TAMBÃ‰M

author: Sam Skolnik
title: Arkansas Law Firm to Face Malpractice Trial Over Business Dispute
text:
An Arkansas law firm and its name partner must face a trial in a legal malpractice lawsuit that involves questions over whether the lawyer actually represented an accounting firm involved in a business dispute.
A federal judge denied a motion for summary judgment from the Story Law Firm and attorney Travis W. Story after being unpersuaded by Storyâ€™s contention that he and his firm didnâ€™t have an attorney-client relationship with the plaintiff, Iron Tax, Accounting & Financial Solutions LLC.
Since attorney-client relationships hinge on â€œthe engagement or consultation of a lawyer by a clientâ€ to obtain legal services, â€œthe Court ...

author: @WMassNews
title: Berry farms thriving despite recent heat wave
text: Berry farms thriving despite recent heat wave SPRINGFIELD, Mass. (WGGB/WSHM) - Blueberry picking season is in full swing and local berry farms around western Mass are working hard to ensure every visitor experiences the joy of picking the best blueberries they can find. Whether youâ€™re a seasoned berry picker or a first timer, right now is the perfect opportunity to take part in this yearâ€™s blueberry picking season. Western Mass News stopped by the Pie in the Sky Berry Farm in Northampton where they told us thanks to plenty of rainfall last year, the blueberries are thriving, with several different varieties for customers to choose from. â€œThis year itâ€™s been fantastic. Actually, the blueberries really loved all the rain we got last year so you know as farmers we rely on whatever mother nature has to offer up to us, so we just adapt to whether itâ€™s a drought or whether itâ€™s rain and we just hope people come out here and enjoy this organic fruit,â€ Kristen Sykes, vice president of marketing and communication at Pie in the Sky Berry Farm. She highlighted that their 8.5-acre farmland is protected by the state, so it is important for them to embrace all organic farming methods to help keep a sustainable environment for not only their crops but also for the diverse wildlife that call this land home. â€œSo, we have planted a lot of things for pollinators and for birds so because weâ€™re on the Connecticut River itâ€™s a really important fly way, itâ€™s a part of the Silvio O. Conte National Fish and Wildlife Refuge and so we have so many different bird species and then we have dragonflies and fireflies. And because of our organic practices, and we really treat the soil well, weâ€™re really almost like a habitat for wildlife in addition to a habitat for people to come and pick fruit,â€ she explained. Sykes said people are usually surprised to know that this farm exists in Northampton, located behind the fairgrounds and I-91. She said they always want to ensure people from all over western Mass are able to come out and be able to spend time in nature while also picking sweet, organic fruit at a reasonable price. â€œSo, itâ€™s 8 dollars a quart and theyâ€™re all organic and we intentionally make sure that our prices are affordable for people, whether itâ€™s the blueberries, the strawberries, or the flowers because we really want to make sure that people have access to fresh local food.â€ So, right now, we are in the height of blueberry season and Pie in the Sky Berry Farm will have several varieties of ripe organic blueberries available for the next two weeks. [https://www.buylocalfood.org/directory/listing/pie-in-the-sky-berry-farm?](https://www.buylocalfood.org/directory/listing/pie-in-the-sky-berry-farm?) Copyright 2024. Western Mass News (WGGB/WSHM). All rights reserved.

author: Sumedh Joshi
title: Tom Brady lays down how important it was for 49ers to keep Trent Williams: â€œI would be driving him to work every day if I was the quarterbackâ€
text:
Tom Brady lays down how important it was for 49ers to keep Trent Williams: â€œI would be driving him to work every day if I was the quarterbackâ€
Trent Williams signed a three-year contract worth $82.6 million with the 49ers which ensures he will remain in the Bay Area through 2027.
Tom Brady and Trent Williams (Image via IMAGO)
The San Francisco 49ers made Trent Williams the highest-paid left tackle in NFL history. He signed a three-year contract worth $82.6 million with a signing bonus of $25.7 million and $48 million in guaranteed money. Williams is coming off a phenomenal year wherein he had a 95.8% pass-block win rate. The move was commended by fans of the 49ers.
Tom Brady, former NFL quarterback and now an analyst for Fox Sports, praised the
San Francisco 49ers for not letting Trent Williams walk. In his most recent appearance on The Herd with Colin Cowherd, Brady revealed that if he were in Brock Purdyâ€™s position, he would have gone out of his way to ensure the left tackle returned.
I would be driving him to work every day if I was the quarterback. I'd be making sure Trent was with me every single place I went. There's no better protector in the NFL than Trent over the years.Tom Brady said
Williams has played a key role in ensuring Brock Purdyâ€™s exposed blind side is protected at all times. Brady gave props to the talent on the 49ersâ€™ offensive roster but believes that without
Trent Williams, the teamâ€™s run game would not be as good.
Obviously, San Francisco's run game is incredible, the way they scheme their run game up, but having Trent in there it's an entirely different offense because of his athleticism, his rare combination of size, of quickness, of power. When he gets out there on the field, he's a matchup advantage for the 49ers every time he takes a snap.Tom Brady added
The seven-time Super Bowl champion understands the importance of having a tackle who is athletic, strong, and possesses quick reflexes.
Trent Williams held out from the 49ers minicamp and preseason until he signed his extension
Due to Williamsâ€™ ability to do his job at the highest level, the 49ers are in a position to make the most out of their run game and give Brock Purdy enough time to read the defense and make the right throw. Brady iterated that when 71 is out there on the field, the quarterback and the running back can be sure that they will be protected.
When they have him out there, they all feel confident, a lot of those plays are going to go to the left side of the line of scrimmage right behind him. They know that when he's in pass protection he's going to hold up as well as anybody, it doesn't matter who he's going up against. He's a tremendous player.Tom Brady said
Tom Brady broke down the importance of having a player of Trent Williamsâ€™ caliber in oneâ€™s corner. His consistency has shown that there is no reason for his teammates to question his abilities no matter who he goes up against.
Tom Brady on how important it was to get Trent Williams back on the field:â€” Coach Yac ðŸ—£ (@Coach_Yac)
â€œI would be driving him to work every day if I was the quarterback. Iâ€™d be making sure Trent was with me every single place I went. Thereâ€™s no better protector in the NFL than Trent over the years.â€¦
[pic.twitter.com/ohZYlc15Lg] [September 4, 2024]
Since joining the 49ers in 2020, Trent Williams has been atop
Pro Football Focusâ€˜ grades for tackles with the exception of 2023 wherein he ranked 2nd. Williams has posted exceptional run-blocking grades with a 97.7 grade in 2021, the highest by any offensive lineman in PFF history. If the 49ers had failed to retain Williams, their offense would have undoubtedly struggled.
It has been a stressful free agency for Kyle Shanahan and John Lynch who have
worked overtime to ensure they retain Brandon Aiyuk and Trent Williams but it is safe to say that the 49ers have just as good a shot this season to return to the Super Bowl.
In case you missed it:

author: RedacciÃ³n
title: Vuelven las tormentas a Barcelona: el Meteocat pone en alerta naranja por lluvias y granizo a varias zonas de Catalunya
text: En plena entrada al mes de agosto, EspaÃ±a atraviesa ya la tercera ola de calor del verano. Y es que, aunque los ambientes veraniegos y las temperaturas asfixiantes tardaron en venir durante el primer mes de este verano, ahora lo han hecho con fuerza. Sin embargo, las previsiones no son las mismas para todo el territorio espaÃ±ol y, en Catalunya, parece que dejaremos a un lado los cielos soleados durante unos dÃ­as. Para este viernes 2 de agosto, el Servei MeteorolÃ²gic de Catalunya (Meteocat), pinta un mapa lleno de alertas naranjas y amarillas de peligro por intensidad de las lluvias en casi todos los municipios del territorio catalÃ¡n. Y, es que, aunque las temperaturas seguirÃ¡n siendo bastante altas hoy en Barcelona (al rededor de los 30 grados durante todo el dÃ­a), el Meteocat ya ha anunciado cuÃ¡ndo dejaremos de lado los cielos soleados. Las lluvias llegarÃ¡n a casi toda Catalunya a partir de la tarde de este viernes 2 de agosto, donde se dejarÃ¡n a un lado los cielos despejados que veremos durante la maÃ±ana para sustituirlos por cielos teÃ±idos de gris, lluvias y tormentas que incluso podrÃ¡n ir acompaÃ±adas de granizo, segÃºn ha apuntado el Meteocat en X (antes Twitter). Para la tarde de este viernes, el Meteocat ha puesto en alerta naranja (con peligro de 4 sobre 6 por la intensidad de las lluvias) a algunos municipios del norte y del extremo sudoeste catalÃ¡n. "Los chubascos irÃ¡n acompaÃ±ados de considerable aparato elÃ©ctrico y localmente de fenÃ³menos de tiempo violento", han asegurado en las predicciones de su pÃ¡gina web. De cara al sÃ¡bado 3 de agosto, la previsiÃ³n es que las lluvias y tormentas prosigan a lo largo de la madrugada y que tiendan a remitir durante el dÃ­a, aunque no nos libraremos de los cielos grises.

author: La Tribuna de Albacete
title: El Olympiacos castiga con triples al Real Madrid en su casa
text: Baloncesto - Euroliga El Olympiacos castiga con triples al Real Madrid en su casa Europa Press - jueves, 16 de enero de 2025 86 Real Madrid 96 Olympiacos Derrota merengue frente al sÃ³lido lÃ­der de la Euroliga, con Fournier brillante en sus filas El Olympiacos castiga con triples al Real Madrid en su casa El Real Madrid ha perdido este jueves por 86-96 frente al Olympiacos en la jornada 22 de la temporada regular de la Euroliga, con papel clave del escolta francÃ©s Evan Fournier para los visitantes, que han lucido su liderato a la espera de que jueguen el FenerbahÃ§e y el AS Monaco.En el Movistar Arena, los locales empezaron con un parcial de 9-3 y Georgios Bartzokas gastÃ³ pronto su primer tiempo muerto, del cual sus pupilos volvieron con las pilas cargadas. Esa reacciÃ³n se canalizÃ³ con un triple de Sasha Vezenkov y otro mÃ¡s de Kostas Papanikolaou, empatando la contienda (11-11) a 4:52 de zanjar el primer cuarto.El buen desempeÃ±o de los visitantes tuvo continuidad con un 2+1 de Evan Fournier, sacando falta a Walter 'Edy' Tavares, y luego con un par de acciones certeras de Luca Vildoza, incluyendo un triple frontal y una bonita asistencia a Fournier para anotar con apoyo en tablero. El 12-19 era peligroso y Chus Mateo tambiÃ©n parÃ³ el reloj, con Ã¡nimo de calmar.Y los merengues asÃ­ lo interpretaron, mitigando gracias a Usman Garuba el poste bajo de un Olympiacos encomendado a Fournier desde el perÃ­metro. A 41.1 de la primera pausa reglamentaria, un triple de Dzanan Musa a la contra avivÃ³ al pabellÃ³n tras un taponazo de Mario Hezonja a Papanikolaou, acercando al Real Madrid en el marcador (19-22).Al comienzo del segundo acto, Chus Mateo eligiÃ³ de 'bajitos' a Sergio Llull y AndrÃ©s Feliz, dando tregua a un Facundo Campazzo que no afinaba. Enfrente, Giannoulis Larentzakis habÃ­a entrado para desenvolverse por la bombilla y Nikola Milutinov para urdir el juego interior, conservando la ventaja griega (23-31) a 6:06 del descanso.TambiÃ©n el joven Hugo GonzÃ¡lez, Ãºltimamente preferido antes que Xavi Rathan-Mayes, daba aire en defensa a un Real Madrid inquieto. Pero era espeso todo y Campazzo volviÃ³ a la cancha junto a Tavares, para ayudar a Hezonja y Musa en busca de una remontada que Shaquielle McKissic, Vildoza y Vezenkov complicaron con respectivos triples (36-45).El Ãºltimo medio minuto del cronÃ³metro caldeÃ³ el ambiente, a raÃ­z de una falta de McKissic sobre Tavares y donde la revisiÃ³n arbitral bajo peticiÃ³n local descartÃ³ que fuese antideportiva; y casi de inmediato, a causa de una dudosa falta de Hezonja sobre Vezenkov en la lucha por un rebote. Entre tiros libres y quejas, llegÃ³ el descanso con 38-47.El equipo del Pireo reflejaba predilecciÃ³n por los triples (8 de 18) frente a los tiros de dos (6 de 18) despuÃ©s de 20 minutos, dinÃ¡mica que siguiÃ³ en la reanudaciÃ³n con dos aciertos de Nigel Williams-Goss, desde la esquina y luego en un lateral. AdemÃ¡s, Vezenkov por dentro era otra amenaza para un Real Madrid que no tardÃ³ en verse 44-57 abajo.Tiempo muerto de Mateo, parÃ³n por un problema en los videomarcadores y revisiÃ³n arbitral en una falta poco protestada, Ã©se era el panorama sin chispa que el Movistar Arena veÃ­a a 6:12 de acabar el tercer cuarto. Musa y Campazzo trataron de salir al rescate de los blancos, pero el problema estaba bajo los aros, pues Tavares se cargÃ³ rÃ¡pido de faltas.Con el objetivo de cambiar las tornas, el caboverdiano se sentÃ³ y el conjunto madrileÃ±o posÃ³ en Garuba y en Eli John Ndiaye sus esperanzas. Mientras, los de Bartzokas siguieron a lo suyo y castigaron con tres triples prÃ¡cticamente seguidos, uno con la firma de Vildoza y dos de Fournier, para goce de la grada visitante y ampliando la brecha (54-70).Le salÃ­a poquÃ­simo a un Real Madrid sin magia; Garuba fallÃ³ una canasta fÃ¡cil debajo del aro rival, Campazzo errÃ³ un triple lateral e, 'ipso facto', Llull tampoco colÃ³ otro intento de tres puntos desde el frente. Como un martillo pilÃ³n, Fournier cerrÃ³ el tercer periodo casi sobre la bocina con un nuevo triple, que estableciÃ³ el 54-73.Regresaron Feliz y Rathan-Mayes al juego exterior de los merengues, en aras de probar algo distinto si querÃ­an otra de esas remontadas de pelÃ­cula. Un par de canastas de Llull y Hezonja en la 'pintura' asÃ­ lo demostraron (61-78), por lo que Bartzokas solicitÃ³ tiempo muerto; no lo necesitaba Fournier, en estado de gracia con sus lanzamientos lejanos.Otro que aportaba era Milutinov, quien rubricÃ³ el +20 (63-83) con un triple sobre la bocina de posesiÃ³n. McKissic machacÃ³ igualmente con otro triple, el enÃ©simo en la cuenta de un Olympiacos que se durmiÃ³ en los laureles y cerca estuvo de pagarlo caro tras un triple de Llull, un robo de Garuba culminado en bandeja y la apariciÃ³n sorpresa de Rathan-Mayes.El escolta canadiense logrÃ³ un triple a tablero, sobre la bocina de posesiÃ³n y a la remanguillÃ©, y que supuso el 78-86 a 2:19 del final.
